summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Office Inventory feature. All 19 backend API tests passed (100%). All frontend UI tests passed - page loads correctly, stats cards display, Add/Edit/Assign/Return/History modals work, filters function properly, staff access correctly restricted.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/inventory requires authentication (401/403)
Backend: POST /api/inventory requires authentication (401/403)
Backend: Inventory endpoints require admin role (staff gets 403)
Backend: GET /api/inventory returns items, categories, and stats
Backend: GET /api/inventory?category=laptop filters by category
Backend: GET /api/inventory?status=available filters by status
Backend: GET /api/inventory?search=macbook searches by name
Backend: POST /api/inventory creates new item with correct fields
Backend: GET /api/inventory/{id} returns item with assignment history
Backend: GET /api/inventory/{id} returns 404 for nonexistent item
Backend: PUT /api/inventory/{id} updates item and persists changes
Backend: DELETE /api/inventory/{id} deletes available item
Backend: POST /api/inventory/{id}/assign assigns item to staff
Backend: POST /api/inventory/{id}/assign fails for already assigned item (400)
Backend: POST /api/inventory/{id}/assign fails for nonexistent staff (404)
Backend: POST /api/inventory/{id}/return returns item from staff
Backend: POST /api/inventory/{id}/return fails for available item (400)
Backend: DELETE /api/inventory/{id} fails for assigned item (400)
Backend: Assignment history shows correct records
Frontend: Office Inventory page loads with data-testid='office-inventory-page'
Frontend: Stats cards show Total Items, Assigned, Available counts
Frontend: Add Item button opens modal with all form fields
Frontend: Add Item modal creates new item with success toast
Frontend: Edit button opens modal with pre-filled data
Frontend: Edit modal updates item with success toast
Frontend: Search filter filters items by name/serial
Frontend: Category filter filters items by category
Frontend: Status filter filters items by status
Frontend: Assign button opens modal with staff dropdown
Frontend: Assign modal assigns item with success toast
Frontend: Return button opens modal with condition dropdown
Frontend: Return modal returns item with success toast
Frontend: History button opens modal showing assignment history
Frontend: Delete button deletes available items
Frontend: Delete button disabled for assigned items
Frontend: Office Inventory NOT visible to staff users (correct access control)
seed_data_creation: Created and cleaned up test items (TEST_Phone_UI, TEST_Monitor_4d5c3a42). Final state: 1 item (MacBook Pro 14) assigned to Staff User.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Office Inventory feature fully tested. Backend endpoints: GET /api/inventory (list with filters), POST /api/inventory (create), GET /api/inventory/{id} (single item with history), PUT /api/inventory/{id} (update), DELETE /api/inventory/{id} (delete if not assigned), POST /api/inventory/{id}/assign (assign to staff), POST /api/inventory/{id}/return (return from staff). Collections: inventory_items, inventory_assignments. Categories: laptop, monitor, phone, furniture, other. Conditions: good, fair, poor. Status: available, assigned. Frontend component at /app/frontend/src/components/OfficeInventory.js with data-testid attributes for all interactive elements. Page accessible via sidebar nav-inventory, only visible to admin/master_admin users.
